Compute exceedances of a threshold for a time series

exceedances.Rd

Compute exceedances of a threshold for a time series

Usage

exceedances(x, ...)

# Default S3 method
exceedances(x, ...)

# S3 method for class 'nhpp'
exceedances(x, ...)

# S3 method for class 'ts'
exceedances(x, ...)

# S3 method for class 'double'
exceedances(x, threshold = mean(x, na.rm = TRUE), ...)

Arguments

x

a numeric vector coercible into a stats::ts object

...

arguments passed to methods

threshold

A value above which to exceed. Default is the mean()

Value

An ordered integer vector giving the indices of the values of x that exceed the threshold.

See also

Other tidychangepoint-generics: changepoints.mod_cpt(), diagnose.mod_cpt(), fitness.seg_basket(), seg_params.seg_cpt()

Examples

fit_nhpp(DataCPSim, tau = 826) |> exceedances()
#>   [1]   20   51   60  221  226  233  271  308  354  415  488  548  553  556  557
#>  [16]  561  562  566  571  575  581  583  589  590  596  598  604  605  609  613

fit_nhpp(DataCPSim, tau = 826, threshold = 200) |> exceedances()
#>  [1]  953  973  982  988  998  999 1003 1007 1018 1032 1033 1039 1041 1049 1055
